column5: Timber Edge Camps has really good August fishing on Minnitaki Lake. www.timberedgecamps.com
Looking for a drive to fish camp in Ontario Canada in August> I;ve been to Lac Suel Wabanskang. and Red. Any body got any other suggestions? Gullrock? any favorites? Thanks Gene
Camp Lake St. Joseph or The Old Post. Both on Lake St. Joseph. One plain the other fancy.

Greetings,I have two suggestions to ponder. First, ask "why" is someone recommending a particular lodge/lake. Nearly every lodge in Ontario is hosted by great people and offers great fishing. A perfect lodge/lake for someone might be a complete disaster for the next person. In other words, know what factors about a lodge/lake are important to you and your group.The second suggestion is to develop a "short list" of lodges/lakes to investigate at a nearby "All Canada" type sports show this winter that might be near where you live. The internet and referrals might help develop the short list of candidates. The "problem" is that all lodges and lakes look great on the internet. Meet and spend time with the lodge owners to find out who and what is behind the internet website. Trust your intuition!The bottom line is that it's your time and money when it comes to your vacation. Spend both wisely!Good fishing and tight lines!!

Seems like you have been through the vermilion bay area.so if your looking near there again there are a number of camps on eagle lake.fishing there is great.i normally fish out of north shore lodge,on the east side of the lake.big lake with a span of 65 mi.east to west.some have american plan some not.big camps and small camps.also check out cedar lake.smaller body of water but has some good fishing with 5 camps on it with access to perrault lake.i spend most of my time out of clarkes northern lights resort.great spot,great equipment and all the bait you need for free during your stay.if you need more info on other camps just message me.

Can you give us more details? American or HSK plan, I assume your taking your boat, rough budget, species etc. Some are more geared for families vs fishermen etc.I'm a LOTW guy, there is everything there(for me) but some don't like big water.

Yes.some people dont like the rough days.me neither.i use my boat at times but usually take camp boats out.outfitters are fine.always calm water someplace.just need to get to it.lol.if you want that info give me a call.much easier than typing. John 1-807-220-0860.
Mylie's Place is about as good of a drive in resort as you can find.

We've been going to Timber Edge Camps on Butterfly Lake which feeds into Minnitaki. Good Walleye, Northern, and Smallies. We normally go in June, but there is a huge amount of water of all depths and type. Also heard good things about Donnelys(sp?) just up the road on the Pickerel Arm of Minnitaki.
Check out www.birchdalelodge.com on Eagle Lake. 807-227-5262 owners name is Marcel. Nice cabins and equipment, American Plan is unique, food is great.
O'Sullivan's Rainbow, on O'Sullivan Lake, near Nakina. Good walleye fishing, nice place, remote drive-to. Bill
